channel.title: Power on R Doodles
channel.description: Recent content in Power on R Doodles

item.title: Should we be skeptical of a "large" effect size if p > 0.05?
item.description: Motivator: A twitter comment “Isn’t the implication that the large effect size is a direct byproduct of the lack of power? i.e. that if the the study had more power, the effect size would have been found to be smaller.”1 2 A thought: our belief in the magnitude of an observed effect should be based on our priors, which, hopefully, are formed from good mechanistic models and not sample size“.
